title: Kubernetes Cheat Sheet (Updated for 2024)
description: A comprehensive cheat sheet for Kubernetes commands with the latest updates.

children.value: A comprehensive cheat sheet for Kubernetes commands with the latest updates.
command shorter and faster to type, you can create an alias.
Contexts manage the connection parameters for clusters, namespaces, and authentication.
Set the default namespace for the current context
For switching between contexts quickly, consider using

props.code:
kubectl get all
kubectl get namespaces
kubectl get configmaps
kubectl get nodes
kubectl get pods
kubectl get rs
kubectl get svc <service-name>
kubectl get endpoints <endpoint-name>

children.value: To switch namespaces for commands without specifying each time, consider using

props.code:
kubectl get pods -l environment=production,tier!=frontend
kubectl get pods -l 'environment in (production,test),tier notin (frontend,backend)'

children.value: Detailed information and deletion of resources.
is recommended for most operations as it applies changes to resources while respecting existing configurations.
Apply a configuration from a file
Export YAML for New and Existing Objects
Generate YAML for a new pod (dry run)
Export YAML of an existing object
Get logs from a previously terminated container
Directly access applications or services from your local machine.

props.code:
## Rollouts and Versioning

Manage deployment rollouts.

- **Check rollout status**
```bash
kubectl rollout status deployment/<deployment-name>

children.value:

Manage deployment rollouts.
